CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 20, 1970, pg. 16, reads: "T-T Chapter - As a result of the successful fund-raising affair sponsored recently by the Pittsburgh Chapter of Tots and Teens, Inc., the group will be able to complete payment on their NAACP live membership, ans establish a fund to provide clothing for needy children.  Members are seated from left: Mmes. William (Lillian) Ward, Jesse (Jean) Bolden, Robert (Beatrice) Mahaffey, Alfred (Ardell) Hopson, president; Robert (Marion) Russell, dance chairman; Melvin (Buena) Smith, Hubert (Louise) Smith, and Alfred (Martha) Hunt.  Standing: Mmes. Joseph (Elnedia) Barrow, Melvin (Joyce) Lewis, dance co-chairman; Lawrence (Betty) Moncrief, James (Rebecca) Armstrong, James (Mary Ann) Lightfoot, Thomas (Phyllis) Hull, Wilmer (Marion) Barnes, Charles (Ruth) Franklin, Carl (Delores) Southers, Asby (Thelma) Dunning, Herbert (Ardella) Campbell, Curtis (Betty) Watkins and Leo (Viola) Woods."
TitMainTitle: Members of Tots and Teens, seated from left: Lillian Ward, Jean Bolden, Beatrice Mahaffey, Ardell Hopson, Marion Russell, Buena Smith, Louise Smith, Martha Hunt; standing: Elnedia Barrow, Joyce Lewis, Betty Moncrief, Rebecca Armstrong, Mary Ann Lightfoot, Phyllis Hull, Marion Barnes, Ruth Franklin, Delores Southers, Thelma Dunning, Ardella Campbell, Betty Watkins, and Viola Woods posed in Roosevelt Hotel
